guide.introduction: The reaction of when a regular mint (or fruit) Mentos is dropped into a bottle of diet Coke can create a fountain of soda. Without a nozzle, you will have a Coke fountain only about 5 feet high. With this, you can have a Coke fountain up to 10 feet! Here's how to make your own nozzle for cheap.
guide.introduction_rendered:
The reaction of when a regular mint (or fruit) Mentos is dropped into a bottle of diet Coke can create a fountain of soda. Without a nozzle, you will have a Coke fountain only about 5 feet high. With this, you can have a Coke fountain up to 10 feet! Here's how to make your own nozzle for cheap.

Relevant parts
  • Diet coke 2-liter bottle
  • Mentos, mint or fruit
  • 7 inches of 1/2 inch PVC pipe sc. 40
  • 1/2 inch PVC pipe repair coupler
  • 1/2 inch PVC tee
  • Thin plastic circle
  • PVC primer and cement
  • 5 feet of Kite string
  • 1/8th inch wire
Tools
  • Dremel tool with cutting and grinding bits
  • Drill, or drill press, and 1/8" drill bit
  • Hacksaw
  • Hot Glue gun & hot glue
  • Measuring tape/ruler

parts.text: 7 inches of 1/2 inch PVC pipe sc. 40

parts.notes: from a film canister or a plastic tub to fit over the hole of the PVC tee found in step 1
such as the locking bar from a mousetrap

lines.text: Cut a piece of 1/2" PVC pipe that is 7 inches long and cement that piece to the 1/2" coupler (the small circle in the last pic).
lines.text_raw: Cut a piece of 1/2" PVC pipe that is 7 inches long and cement that piece to the 1/2" coupler (the small circle in the last pic).

lines.text: Now the vertical part of the tee fitting (the larger circle) needs to be cut off with a hacksaw. Cut a piece of the thin plastic to fit over the hole of the "T". Hot glue the plastic to the cut to seal up the hole. Now cement the 1/2" coupler to one end of the tee.
lines.text_raw: Now the vertical part of the tee fitting (the larger circle) needs to be cut off with a hacksaw. Cut a piece of the thin plastic to fit over the hole of the "T". Hot glue the plastic to the cut to seal up the hole. Now cement the 1/2" coupler to one end of the tee.

lines.text: I am using blue duct tape as a substitute for PVC cement!
lines.text_raw: I am using blue duct tape as a substitute for PVC cement!

lines.text: Take the cap off of a new 2-liter bottle of diet coke. Using a Dremel tool with a cutting and grinding stone bit, cut the top out of the cap as seen in the photo so that it is hollow. Hot glue the cap to the other end of the tee. Make sure the assembly still screws onto the bottle before moving on.
lines.text_raw: Take the cap off of a new 2-liter bottle of diet coke. Using a Dremel tool with a cutting and grinding stone bit, cut the top out of the cap as seen in the photo so that it is hollow. Hot glue the cap to the other end of the tee. Make sure the assembly still screws onto the bottle before moving on.

lines.text: Drill two 1/8" holes opposite each other so that the wire can fit through. Make a loop in the wire and tie a 5' length of kite string to the loop. This will be the trigger pin.
lines.text_raw: Drill two 1/8" holes opposite each other so that the wire can fit through. Make a loop in the wire and tie a 5' length of kite string to the loop. This will be the trigger pin.

lines.text: With the assembly in your hands, put 5 Mentos into the chamber and put in the trigger pin. Then, flip it over and screw it onto the bottle making sure the pin doesn't slide out in the process. It will then be armed and ready. Count down from 10, pull the string and a fountain will flow! Happy Making and be prepared to be soaked!

Then, flip it over and screw it onto the bottle making sure the pin doesn't slide out in the process. It will then be armed and ready. Count down from 10, pull the string and a fountain will flow! Happy Making and be prepared to be soaked!

lines.text: You may want the hole in the top of the assembly to be a bit smaller so that the fountain will be higher and/or last longer. Cut another piece of the thin plastic to cover the top end and use hot glue to secure it. Then use a 1/4" to 1/2" drill to make a hole in the plastic.
